HEADQUARTERS
AIR WEATHER SERVICE
MILITARY AIR TRANSPORT SERVICE
UNITED STATES AIR FORCE
Washington 25, D. C.
15 November 1955
Dr. Frank E* Schooley
President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
lh Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Dr. Schooley:
With reference to your letter dated 10 November 1955* we do not
have a pilot tape prepared at this time. However, I am able to give
you all the information, on our proposed series, available now.
Subject to your approval of our plan and pilot tape we should like
to record thirteen quarter-hour programs on weather for release to
the NAEB tape network.
We intend to record the programs as follows. We will record a series
of lectures by distinguished personnel of the Air Weather Service in
the classroom at the University of Maryland. We will produce the
opening and closing portions of the program in our professional studios
in Washington. These openings and closings will be worded to meet
your specifications.
I am enclosing a brief biographical sketch of our announcer and myÂ¬
self (I shall produce the series) for your perusal. I am also enclosing
a list of the thirteen speakers and their subjects for your consideration.
I believe that they will cover the weather field most adequately. These
lectures are expected to commence around the first of February and we
can get the master tape to you within a week following each recording.
I mention this so that you may make your plans accordingly.
If you will need more detailed information at any time, please feel
free to contact me.
Chief, Radio-TV Branch
Office Information Services
